page.title: 08SAINT MARK'S CHURCH,GLODWICK
page.content: Saint Mark's is the Parish Church of Glodwick, Oldham.Built at a cost of Â£10.000, in 1876, the building is an elegant stone edifice in the early English style of architecture. of special note are the polished granite pillars and the graceful stone arches that divide the aisles from the nave. Thesprie, which contains a clock and a peal of eight bells, rises to a heigt of 141 feet, and sited as it is at the top of a hill, dominates the local landscape. Alough Saint Mark's stands in the middle of what is now a predominantly Asian residential area, it is a thriving religious and social commuynity, drawing a congregation of about 160 people each week.The congregation is multi-racial.The Vicar is Japanese.The Vicar officiates at approx. 10 weddings each year.Social activities are Youth Clubs,Brownies.
